results.title: Agentic AI Takes Over â€” 11 Shocking 2026 Predictions - Forbes
results.content:
But AI will not be limited to algorithms and screens; it will also be on the production floor in the form of humanoid robotics. Nvidiaâ€™s Jensen Huang calls this the age of physical AI. Humanoid robots will transition from demonstrations to targeted commercial pilots in warehouses and factories (with leaders like Tesla, Figure and Agility aiming for thousands to tens of thousands of units), augmenting workers in controlled environments while proving safety and ROI.

Beyond factories, 2026 will see AI accelerate scientific and healthcare discovery, designing experiments, predicting outcomes and co-authoring breakthroughs in drug development and materials science.

4. Multi-Agent Orchestration Becomes the Enterprise Breakthrough

In 2026, single agents will evolve into orchestrated multi-agent systems something like dozens or hundreds of specialized agents collaborating on complex, long-running tasks like supply chain optimization, R&D pipelines or patient care journeys. Forrester warns of a major agentic breach without proper orchestration. [...] 3. Physical AI Pilots Transform Manufacturing and Beyond

Skilled labor shortages have become structural. Pipe fitters, technicians and experienced operators are in short supply worldwide. In 2026, manufacturers will turn to AI not just to save costs but to survive.

AI will augment skilled workers by automating repetitive tasks, improving safety outcomes, optimizing supply chains and personalizing training at scale. Companies that embrace AI-driven productivity will dominate production and cost efficiency. Those that do not will fall behind quickly.

While many industries struggle to quantify AI returns, manufacturing offers controlled environments where results can be proven with complex numbers. Defect rates will drop, production will increase and cycle times will shrink. The industry will shift from pilots and experimentation to enterprise-wide, real-world production. [...] 5. Agentic AI Runs Logistics and Production

In 2026, agentic AI will manage logistics and production end-to-end. AI agents will reroute inventory in real time, expedite shipments, allocate maintenance resources and dynamically adjust manufacturing based on need. Businesses that adopt agentic systems early will gain structural operational advantages over competitors.

6. Amazon Reemerges as an AI Infrastructure Leader

After a period of relative underperformance, Amazon will reassert itself in 2026 as AWS reaccelerates. Compute bottlenecks will fade, Trainium chips will see real enterprise adoption and AWS growth will reaccelerate to high-teens or low-20s percentages, driven by Trainium adoption and easing capacity constraints.

According to McKinsey, AI infrastructure spending continues toward a projected $7 trillion value. Amazonâ€™s integrated cloud, compute and tooling ecosystem will position it as a central beneficiary of the next phase of AI adoption.

results.title: In 2026, AI will move from hype to pragmatism | TechCrunch
results.content:
Image Credits:David Paul Morris/Bloomberg / Getty Images

Advancements in technologies like small models, world models, and edge computing will enable more physical applications of machine learning, experts say.

â€œPhysical AI will hit the mainstream in 2026 as new categories of AI-powered devices, including robotics, AVs, drones, and wearables start to enter the market,â€ Vikram Taneja, head of AT&T Ventures, told TechCrunch.

While autonomous vehicles and robotics are obvious use cases for physical AI that will no doubt continue to grow in 2026, the training and deployment required is still expensive. Wearables, on the other hand, provide a less expensive wedge with consumer buy-in. Smart glasses like the Ray-Ban Meta are starting to ship assistants that can answer questions about what youâ€™re looking at, and new form factors like AI-powered health rings and smartwatches are normalizing always-on, on-body inference. [...] Image Credits:Photo by Bolivia Inteligente on Unsplash

AI

, a â€œUSB-C for AIâ€ that lets AI agents talk to the external tools like databases, search engines, and APIs, proved the missing connective tissue and is quickly becoming the standard. OpenAI and Microsoft have publicly embraced MCP, and Anthropic recently donated it to theLinux Foundationâ€™s new Agentic AI Foundation, which aims to help standardize open source agentic tools. Google also has begun standing up its own managed MCP servers to connect AI agents to its products and services.

With MCP reducing the friction of connecting agents to real systems, 2026 is likely to be the year agentic workflows finally move from demos into day-to-day practice.

Rajeev Dham, a partner at Sapphire Ventures, says these advancements will lead to agent-first solutions taking on â€œsystem-of-record rolesâ€ across industries.

results.title: 7 Agentic AI Trends to Watch in 2026 - MachineLearningMastery.com
results.content:
These resources provide the essential knowledge base that every machine learning practitioner needs before tackling the advanced trends explored below. If youâ€™re new to agentic AI or want to strengthen your fundamentals, we recommend reviewing these articles first. They establish the common language and core concepts that the following trends build upon. Think of them as prerequisite courses before advancing to the cutting edge of whatâ€™s emerging in 2026.

## Seven Emerging Trends Defining 2026

### 1. Multi-Agent Orchestration: The â€œMicroservices Momentâ€ for AI

The agentic AI field is going through its microservices revolution. Just as monolithic applications gave way to distributed service architectures, single all-purpose agents are being replaced by orchestrated teams of specialized agents. Gartner reported a staggering 1,445% surge in multi-agent system inquiries from Q1 2024 to Q2 2025, signaling a shift in how systems are designed. [...] ## Navigating the Agentic Transition

The trends shaping 2026 represent more than incremental improvements. They signal a restructuring of how we build, deploy, and govern AI systems. The organizations that will thrive are those that recognize agentic AI isnâ€™t about smarter automation. Itâ€™s about new architectures (multi-agent orchestration), new standards (MCP/A2A protocols), new economics (FinOps for agents), and new organizational capabilities (governance maturity, workflow redesign).

For machine learning practitioners, the path forward is clear:

 Learn the foundational patterns and memory architectures covered in Machine Learning Masteryâ€™s existing guides
 Develop expertise in the emerging trends outlined here
 Start with single-agent systems using proven design patterns
 Add complexity only when simpler approaches fail
 Invest in governance and cost optimization from day one
 Design for human-agent collaboration rather than full automation [...] ### Navigation

Making developers awesome at machine learning

# 7 Agentic AI Trends to Watch in 2026

By Vinod Chugani on January 5, 2026 in Artificial Intelligence  0

7 Agentic AI Trends to Watch in 2026  
Image by Author

The agentic AI field is moving from experimental prototypes to production-ready autonomous systems. Industry analysts project the market will surge from $7.8 billion today to over \$52 billion by 2030, while Gartner predicts that 40% of enterprise applications will embed AI agents by the end of 2026, up from less than 5% in 2025. This growth isnâ€™t only about deploying more agents. Itâ€™s about different architectures, protocols, and business models that are reshaping how we build and deploy AI systems.

## ðŸ“Œ About This Repository

> A practical collection of agentic AI applications designed to address real-world challenges in recruitment, productivity, finance, data analysis, game building, landing page generation, multi-agent email classification, and book creation.

This repository showcases how agent-based systems, LLMs, and modular automation frameworks can be used to solve practical challenges. Each project here isnâ€™t just a demo â€” itâ€™s a working system that:

solves a real problem, [...] solves a real problem,

uses open and modern tools like Groq, CrewAI, and Phidata,

and is easy to run, customize, and learn from.

Whether you're a beginner learning how LLM agents work or a developer looking to build your own AI assistant â€” these examples are a great place to start.

## ðŸ¤– Why Agentic AI?

Traditional AI workflows often involve single-shot predictions or static pipelines. Agentic AI introduces persistent, goal-driven agents capable of reasoning, planning, and adapting their behavior over time.

Key advantages:

 âœ… Autonomy â€“ Agents can operate independently or in collaboration
 ðŸ” Modularity â€“ Plug-and-play components using orchestration frameworks
 ðŸ§  LLM-Powered Intelligence â€“ Natural language reasoning, dynamic decision making
 ðŸ“¡ Interoperability â€“ Easily integrates with APIs, databases, and user-facing apps

## ðŸ§© Use Cases

The repository addresses a diverse range of automation opportunities: [...] If you run into any issues or have questions, each project README includes troubleshooting tips and contact information.

We welcome your ideas, feedback, and pull requests! See individual project READMEs for guidelines.

## ðŸ“„ License

This repository is licensed under the MIT License. You're free to use, modify, and distribute with attribution.

â­ï¸ If you find these projects valuable, star this repo and help spread the agentic AI movement!

## About

A curated collection of production-ready agentic AI projectsâ€”showcasing automation, LLMs, and intelligent agents for real-world applications.

results.title: Industrial AI: Transforming Manufacturing - YouTube
results.content:
### Description
4314 views
Posted: 7 Feb 2025
In this episode of the Light on Data Show, hosts George and Diana explore the transformative potential of AI in the manufacturing and industrial sectors. Their guest, Bryan DeBois, Director of Industrial AI at RoviSys, shares insights from his 25 years of experience. They discuss the primary drivers for AI adoption, including the critical loss of expertise due to the 'silver tsunami', and the need for advanced technologies to enhance productivity and efficiency. Bryan explains the different types of AI being deployed, such as traditional AI, autonomous AI agents, and generative AI, and highlights the importance of AI readiness assessments and the challenges posed by legacy systems. He also addresses organizational change management and cybersecurity concerns associated with AI deployment on the plant floor. Tune in for expert advice on taking the first steps toward industrial AI implementation and understanding the pivotal role it can play in modern manufacturing. [...] 00:00 Welcome to the Light on Data Show
00:28 Introduction to Industrial AI with Brian Dubois
00:59 Challenges and Drivers for Industrial AI Adoption
04:53 Types of AI in the Industrial Space
08:31 Limitations and Concerns of Generative AI
13:29 Deploying AI in Manufacturing: Requirements and Readiness
26:34 Advice for Industrial Leaders on AI Adoption
28:18 Conclusion and Farewell

â˜• If you found this content useful and would like to support the channel, you can buy me a coffee: 

 
My mission at LightsOnData is to:
 
1ï¸âƒ£ Provide current and future data professionals with increased knowledge and better understanding of data governance, data management, and data storytelling.

2ï¸âƒ£ Provide simple, fun, and engaging, as well as thorough explanations, teachings, and advice on important, but otherwise boring and dry topics of the data world. Posted: 28 Nov 2025
Topic: Real-World Lessons from Deploying AI for Population-Scale Chest X-Ray Screening
Speaker: Dr. Ronnie Rajan, Vice President of AI & Applied Sciences at M42
Abstract: Despite remarkable progress in medical imaging AI research, only a small number of models have been deployed safely and responsibly in clinical operations. M42â€™s AIRIS-TB is a screening tool designed to automate reporting of normal chest X-rays in large-scale TB screening programs, addressing the redundancy inherent to low-prevalence workflows. This talk will outline the modelâ€™s development, calibration to achieve near-zero TB false-negative rates, and integration across screening centers. Beyond technical details, it will share lessons in addressing data imbalance, selecting clinically meaningful metrics, navigating regulatory uncertainties, building clinician trust, and driving adoption, offering a grounded view of what responsible, real-world AI deployment in healthcare looks like. He has over seven years experience bridging medicine and data science to enable the responsible adoption of AI in healthcare. results.title: Let's Talk Evolution #7 - AI in Traditional Industries - YouTube
results.content:
# Let's Talk Evolution #7 - AI in Traditional Industries: From Data to Deployment
## Evolution Recruitment Solutions
190 subscribers

### Description
45 views
Posted: 22 Oct 2025
In this episode of Let's Talk Evolution, Jin Lee, Co-Founder of TicTag, shares how traditional industries are embracing AI and what it truly takes to move from raw data to full-scale AI deployment. Starting as a pandemic-era startup focused on crowdsourced data annotation, TicTag has grown into a company delivering complete AI solutions across retail, manufacturing, mining, and logistics. Jin explains how the company integrates social impact by employing diverse groups, including people with disabilities, while maintaining world-class data accuracy through gamification and multi-layer quality checks. [...] Welcome to Let's Talk Evolution, the podcast where real life experience meets the complexities of today's tech industry. Each episode we dive into a specific topic with thought leaders who knows the systems, the structures, and the nuances that drive the industry. This series is all about unpacking the inner workings of tech and learning from the people who understand it best. I'm Danell from Evolution Recruitment Solutions, and today I am your host. In this episode, we're unpacking how traditional industries are embracing AI and what it really takes to move from data to deployment. From retail and manufacturing to mining and logistics, many longestablished sectors are now exploring how to modernize through AI, but are facing challenges in scaling, data readiness, and workforce adoption. Joining us today is Jin Lee, co-founder of Tic Tac, a company that began with crowdsource data annotation and has since evolved into delivering cuttingedge AI solutions for businesses across Asia. Jyn has led teams that bridge the gap between

# Beyond the hype, how industries are deploying AI at the heart of their operations
## World Economic Forum
999000 subscribers
63 likes

### Description
2542 views
Posted: 3 Apr 2025
There was the hype, then the testing, now companies are deploying artificial intelligence at the heart of their operations. We ask one of the world's most prominent AI scientists for his advice for companies, and hear how Siemens is creating the 'brains' to run the factories of the future.
 

Guests:  Andrew Ng, managing general partner of AI FUNDS and founder of DeepLearning.AI  Cedrik Neike, CEO Digital Industries, Siemens
 

Cathy Li, Head, AI, Data and Metaverse, World Economic Forum
 

Kiva Allgood, Head, Centre for Advanced Manufacturing & Supply Chains, World Economic Forum
 

Links:

civilians it was the launch of chat GPT at the end of 2022 that really brought it to our attention this amazing thing and there was there was maybe a hype bubble for you know the rest of year 2023 and now I think everyone Industries and just normal people who have access to anything like chat gbt or any of those other things many of which are free um what do I actually do with this so you've got could you tell us something about him he's someone he's been on radio Davos before remind us who Andrew un is and what he's going to talk about Andrew we work with with him very closely he's a legendary AI researcher um and uh he runs AI fund now he also is part of numerous AI startups including ker which is a household name Andre goes into how AI is evolving not just in in terms of technical advancements but in how businesses are shifting from a theoretical dis uh discussions to real practical applications he highlights how AI is been used in Industries Beyond Tech from uh optimizing pricing strategies to uh uh streamlining legal document processing and even facilitating crossb trade he also talks about a key shift happening right now moving beyond the AI hype and focusing on tangible business value one of his most interesting points is that ai's biggest impact isn't just in the foundation models uh we hear so much about but in the applications buil uh on

results.title: The Industrial AI Revolution: Siemens Keynote at CES 2026
results.content:
Key Announcements & Highlights:
 Siemens & @NVIDIA Partnership: Roland Busch and Jensen Huang discuss the expansion of their partnership to build the "Industrial AI Operating System." Learn how they are closing the gap between ideas and reality by integrating AI-native engineering and "active intelligence."
 Introducing Digital Twin Composer: A new tool available mid-2026 to power the industrial metaverse at scale.
 Real-World Impact: Athina Kanioura shares how @PepsiCo is using Siemens Digital Twin Composer to simulate and upgrade facilities with 90% issue detection before physical implementation.
 Siemens & @Microsoft: Jay Parikh joins the stage to discuss bridging IT and OT, highlighting the launch of 9 new Industrial Copilots designed to streamline manufacturing and operations.
 The Future of Energy: Bob Mumgaard explains how @CommonwealthFusionSystems is leveraging Siemens technology to accelerate the path to commercial clean fusion energy. [...] In this keynote, discover how Siemens is combining the real and digital worlds to accelerate innovation, resilience, and sustainability. From a massive expansion of the NVIDIA partnership to the launch of the Digital Twin Composer, see how AI is moving from "feature" to "force" across the entire industrial value chain.

Digital Twin Composer: 
Deploying AI with real impact: [...] or less before intelligence is embedded
in the system we rely on every day. And that changes something fundamentally, because when an AI enters a physical system, it stops being a feature. It becomes a force. A force with direct real world impact. A force that transforms
how we design and build, how factories produce, how infrastructure operates,
how the world powers itself. Now, how do we do it? How can we make this happen? How can we do all of this
at speed and scale and at the same time, in a way that it's reliable and safe and hallucination is not acceptable. when AI is deployed
in the industrial world. Today we are making it easy for you
to scale industrial AI in the real world systems
to create real world impact. We are bringing together
AI powered technologies, industrial domain know how
